phrase.item: This story is about a hunter.
Once there was a hunter.
All the time, it doesn't matter if it was in winter, summer, spring, or fall all four seasons, all he did was hunt.
One day in winter, he went hunting.
He stood on top of some ice.
The ice was cracked.
He didn't notice and fell into the crack.
He couldn't get out of there.
He tried so hard, but wasn't able to come out.
Suddenly, he realized there were so many snakes around him.
He didn't know how to get rid of them.
Then he hid himself in a corner and didn't move.
At that time, all the snakes came and tried to attack him.
They got close to him, but there was a big white snake, the biggest one among then, which came in front of the others.
It didn't let them get close to the man.
He also, being a hero, had patience.
Three months passed that way.
The man was stuck in the crack.
It was a crack in stone, not ice.
The man said: "How can I get out of here?
I don't even know the way [road].
He was inside the crack for a while. Then the white snake told the others: "We should help him.
The hot [weather] time is coming."
So, the [white snake] said to the long black snake, "You take him out."
He said to the hero, "You hold yourself in its tail."
The snake kept going through the crack, The hero-man held its tail and came out
The white snake said: "You go, but don't tell our secret to anyone, how we took care of you."
He promised, saying, "Yes, I won't tell."
He went to his house, and when he reached his village, everyone was surprised,
and they said, "Where were you?"
You disappeared for three months, we thought you were gone.
We did your death ceremony."
The man said, "I fell into a crack
That cracked [place] belonged to a bear.
I slaughtered the bear and wore its skin.
I stayed inside the crack.
Other bears thought I was also a bear.
And they didn't tell me anything.
Later, all the bears came out of that crack and I also came out with them.
When I got out into the forest, I was barely able to run away from them."
Then he came, with his children, into his house with his wife.
Like that, they lived happily for a while.
The king heard the news.
The king ordered, "Bring me that person!"
[He was brought] and they asked him, "How do you do?"
He said the same to the king.
The king's children didn't believe him and hit him a lot.
The man couldn't handle the pain, and told them his secret.
He said, "I fell into a crack.
The crack belonged to snakes.
All the snakes wanted to attack me, but a white snake helped me.
All the other snakes couldn't do anything."
Then the king said, "You should go and show us the place".
The poor man had no choice, went and showed him the place.
They entered the crack.
As there were so many snakes, they bit all the people and killed them.
Only the white snake came to the edge of the crack.
And he told to the man, "Hey, hero!
I did a favor for you.
I was taking are of you and protected you. I sent you back to your children.
I sent you to your homeland.
But you did an unfair thing to me.
‎‎You told [people] about our place,
but you promised us that you wouldn't tell anyone.
We warned you if you told about our place it would harm you."
Then they killed all other people, but didn't the hero man.
He returned home.
When he reached home, the snakes cast bad spells upon him.
Then the hero's hands and legs got dry [stopped working].
Paralyzed like that, he stayed home.
So that's why I would advise that in your life, whenever you promise something to someone, try to fulfill your promises.
If you cannot fulfill your promises , then it is better not to promise anything to anyone.
